node.statement: AVAILABLE CONSTRAINTS ON CORRECTION VECTORS (alpha, beta). (i) Compatibility: alpha - beta = u - v, since h = u - alpha = v - beta. This is not a free parameter -- it is determined by p, q, r. (ii) Herglotz curvature constraint: from the partial fraction representation omega_i(z) = z + c_i + sum_j m_{ij}/(z - p_{ij}) with m_{ij} > 0, we get omega_i''(nu_k) = sum_j 2 m_{ij}/(nu_k - p_{ij})^3. So alpha_k = sum_j m_{1j}/(nu_k - p_{1j})^3 and beta_k = sum_j m_{2j}/(nu_k - p_{2j})^3. These are NOT arbitrary vectors -- they have the specific structure of discrete Cauchy-type transforms of positive measures evaluated at the roots of r. (iii) The continuum summation relation omega_1 + omega_2 = z + F_{mu boxplus nu}(z) does NOT hold at finite n (verified computationally at n=2). A finite replacement coupling alpha and beta is unknown.
